summary: I went into Good Omens expecting to like Crowley as my fav considering my track record for characters like that and I really...
body:
I went into Good Omens expecting to like Crowley as my fav considering my track record for characters like that and I really like him, he’s fantastic, but man, Michael Sheen as Aziraphale just got me hooked straight away.

Just look at this little soft Marshmallow and his little smile and urgh he’s just so soft and I’m gonna cry

title: In Good Omens
body:
I love the fact that I just saw the characters themselves.

When watching a new series, I often see the actors or their old roles, like seeing the 10th Doctor with David Tennant from time to time instead of a character for example, you see?

BUT here, I just saw Crowley and Aziraphale, and that shows even more what great actors David Tennant and Michael Sheen are! :)

summary:
The thing is, you can’t tell who’s more in love with the other:
Crowley keeps suggesting they go off together, he literally...
body:
The thing is, you can’t tell who’s more in love with the other:

Crowley keeps suggesting they go off together, he literally became suicidal after he thought Aziraphale died and he never failed to express how Aziraphale is his Best Friend.

Aziraphale has this look. God, The Look, His pining voice and the clear influence he absorbed from Crowley. He sees the whole world in Crowley as shown from just that final toast when he said ‘To The World’ like THAT.

summary: Strictly speaking, Shadwell didn't run the WA either. According to Shadwell's pay ledgers it was run by Witchfinder General...
body:
Strictly speaking, Shadwell didn’t run the WA either. According to Shadwell’s pay ledgers it was run by Witchfinder General Smith. Under him were Witchfinder Colonels Green and Jones, and Witchfinder Majors Jackson, Robinson, and Smith (no relation). Then there were Witchfinder Majors Saucepan, Tin, Milk, and Cupboard, because Shadwell’s limited imagination had been beginning to struggle at this point. And Witchfinder Captains Smith, Smith, Smith, and Smythe and Ditto. And five hundred Witchfinder Privates and Corporals and Sergeants. Many of them were called Smith, but this didn’t matter because neither Crowley nor Aziraphale had ever bothered to read that far. They simply handed over the pay.
After all, both lots put together only came to around £60 a year.
Shadwell didn’t consider this in any way criminal. The army was a sacred trust, and a man had to do something. The old ninepences weren’t coming in like they used to.

- Good Omens by Terry Pratchet & Neil Gaiman

tags: tagging in case anyone else could use it
summary: what other michael sheen things should i watch?? i.... love him now??
question: what other michael sheen things should i watch?? i.... love him now??
answer:
omg omg omg omg omg my time has come - quick disclaimer: I have no idea what platforms most of these are available on now as I watched them all back before streaming platforms got big but most of them are available very cheaply as DVDs. Where possible I’ve included links to trailers/compilations and to the full content if it’s on youtube

Bright Young Things is a great watch for young gay foppish Michael Sheen and is a great film in general with a stellar cast (incl a small cameo from David Tennant) (trailer)

The Damned United is my favourite Michael Sheen film and one of my favourite films of all time, it’s a football film that’s not at all about football and him and Timothy Spall are glorious and make me cry everytime and he sings What’s New Pussycat and wears nice shorts at several points and just yes this should probably have been top of the list (trailer)

His episodes of 30 Rock are also up there with my favourite Sheen performances, Wesley Snipes is the love of my life (clip)

Masters of Sex gives you the most Michael Sheen hours and is a fantastic series that didn’t get half the hype it deserved, it has lots of angsty sheen and (as the name suggests) lots of nsfw sheen (trailer)

Michael Sheen: Valley’s Rebellion is a fantastic documentary about the Chartists and present day political apathy (aired before Brexit and Trump but the Chartist history is fascinating, a lot of it is still relevant and it was the first time I remember seeing someone use their platform to talk to foodbank users and people who had been effected by benefit cuts outside of leftwing news outlets and my love and respect for Michael Sheen as a person grew 500 times after watching it) (in its entirety here)

The Banker (which I can no longer seem to find) is a great short as is The Open Doors ft. a very sweet nervy Michael Sheen (here)

The Gospel of Us is brilliant, Michael Sheen staged an immersive version of the Passion Play in his home town of Port Talbot over the Easter Weekend with himself playing Jesus and en ensemble of the local community playing the rest of the parts and this is the film of that (trailer)

He’s got fun bit parts in The Spoils of Babylon (trailer), The Spoils Before Dying (trailer), 7 Days in Hell (trailer), and Michael Bolton’s Big Sexy Valentine’s Day Special (Michael Sheen’s bit)

Michael Sheen Presents You’re The Boss is an hour of Michael Sheen talking about football management which on paper shouldn’t be entertaining but is, in fact an absolute joy (trailer)

Ancient Rome The Rise and Fall of an Empire Episode 2, Michael Sheen as Nero, a stalwart fave and available in its entirety on dailymotion (here)

Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa is heartwrenching and funny and brilliant and is available in its entirety on youtube (here)

Heartlands has a very sweet young Michael Sheen on a trip across the country on his bike and is extremely fluffy (clip)

Far From the Madding Crowd has a v handsome proper Michael Sheen as one of 3 love interests, he’s not got a huge amount of screentime but as ever he makes the most of it and it’s a decent watch (trailer)

The Tony Blair films are all pretty great if you can stand to feel sympathy for a war criminal/ignore that he is playing Tony Blair (though that’s quite difficult as he is very good) The Deal is probably my favourite for sheen content (in full here) then The Special Relationship (trailer) then The Queen (trailer)

Frost/Nixon is another Sheen classic with a great cast (trailer)

Then of course there’s Twilight and the Underworld series for all your Vampire and Werewolf Sheen needs respectively

TRON: Legacy is another fun role but he’s woefully underused (clip)

That should be enough to get you started, there’s also a load of audiobooks and his interviews with Craig Ferguson are great for a laugh, hmu if you’d like any more in-depth or tailored recs I spent the majority of my first year of university staying up until the early hours marathoning his filmography and I am thrilled to finally be able to put that knowledge to use!

The Damned United is my favourite Michael Sheen film and one of my favourite films of all time, it’s a football film that’s not at all about football and him and Timothy Spall are glorious and make me cry everytime and he sings What’s New Pussycat and wears nice shorts at several points and just yes this should probably have been top of the list (trailer)

His episodes of 30 Rock are also up there with my favourite Sheen performances, Wesley Snipes is the love of my life (clip)

Masters of Sex gives you the most Michael Sheen hours and is a fantastic series that didn’t get half the hype it deserved, it has lots of angsty sheen and (as the name suggests) lots of nsfw sheen (trailer)

Michael Sheen: Valley’s Rebellion is a fantastic documentary about the Chartists and present day political apathy (aired before Brexit and Trump but the Chartist history is fascinating, a lot of it is still relevant and it was the first time I remember seeing someone use their platform to talk to foodbank users and people who had been effected by benefit cuts outside of leftwing news outlets and my love and respect for Michael Sheen as a person grew 500 times after watching it) (in its entirety here)

The Banker (which I can no longer seem to find) is a great short as is The Open Doors ft. a very sweet nervy Michael Sheen (here)

The Gospel of Us is brilliant, Michael Sheen staged an immersive version of the Passion Play in his home town of Port Talbot over the Easter Weekend with himself playing Jesus and en ensemble of the local community playing the rest of the parts and this is the film of that (trailer)

He’s got fun bit parts in The Spoils of Babylon (trailer), The Spoils Before Dying (trailer), 7 Days in Hell (trailer), and Michael Bolton’s Big Sexy Valentine’s Day Special (Michael Sheen’s bit)

Michael Sheen Presents You’re The Boss is an hour of Michael Sheen talking about football management which on paper shouldn’t be entertaining but is, in fact an absolute joy (trailer)

Ancient Rome The Rise and Fall of an Empire Episode 2, Michael Sheen as Nero, a stalwart fave and available in its entirety on dailymotion (here)

Kenneth Williams: Fantabulosa is heartwrenching and funny and brilliant and is available in its entirety on youtube (here)

Heartlands has a very sweet young Michael Sheen on a trip across the country on his bike and is extremely fluffy (clip)

Far From the Madding Crowd has a v handsome proper Michael Sheen as one of 3 love interests, he’s not got a huge amount of screentime but as ever he makes the most of it and it’s a decent watch (trailer)

The Tony Blair films are all pretty great if you can stand to feel sympathy for a war criminal/ignore that he is playing Tony Blair (though that’s quite difficult as he is very good) The Deal is probably my favourite for sheen content (in full here) then The Special Relationship (trailer) then The Queen (trailer)

Frost/Nixon is another Sheen classic with a great cast (trailer)

Then of course there’s Twilight and the Underworld series for all your Vampire and Werewolf Sheen needs respectively

TRON: Legacy is another fun role but he’s woefully underused (clip)

That should be enough to get you started, there’s also a load of audiobooks and his interviews with Craig Ferguson are great for a laugh, hmu if you’d like any more in-depth or tailored recs I spent the majority of my first year of university staying up until the early hours marathoning his filmography and I am thrilled to finally be able to put that knowledge to use!

blog.title: Run for your Life
blog.description: Ania. 23. Poland. THIS BLOG IS CURRENTLY A MICHAEL SHEEN MESS. I’m sorry. Tennant is my hero, I ship DTxGT because they are adorable, The Doctor x Rose, Lucifer x Chloe, I love Alec Hardy with my whole heart and still am not okay that Hardy x Miller didn’t happen, I read too much fanfics and still have a soft spot for Downey Jr. Hello!
